title: Why French prosecutors investigating X summoned Elon Musk
subhed: The French investigation that led to a raid on the Paris offices of X on Tuesday is examining a wide range of alleged offenses.
byline: By Florian Reynaud and Martin Untersinger

title: Trump signs spending bill ending US government shutdown
Iran cracks down on medical workers treating protesters
Ukraine seeks countermeasures against Russian drones equipped with Starlink
subhed: A wave of highly accurate and deadly strikes on civilian and military targets far from the front lines has led the Ukrainian government to ask Elon Musk for help. Musk claims to have taken the necessary steps to disable Starlink terminals being used by the Russian military.

title: French prosecutors request Le Pen's election ban be upheld
subhed: Last year, far-right party leader Marine Le Pen was convicted of embezzling EU Parliament funds. She is appealing against the conviction and the sentence that would ban her from running in the presidential election.

title: IOC official says work on 2030 French Alps Winter Olympics is 'behind schedule'
subhed: The day before the announcement, the chair of the 2030 Winter Olympics organising team's compensation committee stepped down, becoming the third senior official to quit in just over two months.

title: Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
subhed: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

title: US jet downs Iran drone but talks still on course
The US says it has deployed a small military team to Nigeria to strengthen the fight against jihadists
Benjamin Netanyahu's four-state solution
Vietnam harbors a profound strategic distrust of the US
EU rejects 'nonsense' censorship charge from Trump allies
Sacked UK envoy Mandelson quits House of Lords over Epstein ties
Luuk van Middelaar: 'With Trump, Europe is suffering an ideological assault from its historic protector'
Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
Gabriel Attal's challenge of breaking with Macron
French NGOs mobilize to remove foxes from national list of pests
Norway crown princess's son pleads not guilty to four counts of rape as trial opens
'Trump has struck at the heart of the defense pact forged between the US and Europe in 1949: Trust'
France's 2026 budget battle is finally over. The next one may be even more complex.
subhed: The Finance Ministry is already working on the next budget bill. On paper, France will need to make a deficit reduction effort twice as great as in 2026. It will be a daunting challenge, so close to the presidential election.

title: Marine Le Pen's double life: Defendant during the week, party leader over the weekend
subhed: The leader of the French far right is waiting to find out whether her ban on running in elections will be upheld. From the Paris appeals court to the municipal election campaign, she wants to give the illusion that life goes on.
byline: By Clément Guillou (Creuzwald (eastern France), special correspondent) and Corentin Lesueur

title: Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhed: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
'Trump's reversals often come after stock market declines'
'It is urgent to prepare for difficult times. France's 2026 budget does exactly the opposite'
